This document summarizes the mathematics underlying weighted regression in the `hdme` package. The idea is to provide a vector $d \in \mathbb{R}^{n}$ of weights, with which each case gets multiplied. We use the notation of @sorensen2015 and @sorensen2018. We also let $D \in \mathbb{R}^{n}$ be a diagonal matrix with the vector $d$ on its diagonal.

# Generalized Dantzig Selector

## Gaussian Case

The Dantzig Selector with weights becomes:

$$
\text{minimize } \beta \text{, subject to } \frac{1}{n}\left\|X^{T} D (y - X \beta) \right\|_{\infty} \leq \lambda
$$
